ingredients.ingredient: ½ cup white sugar, or more to taste

cookingTips: Use glutinous rice flour (mochiko) specifically—regular rice flour won't produce the correct texture
The dough should be smooth and pliable; adjust water gradually if too dry
Dust the work surface with cornstarch or powdered sugar to prevent sticking
enrichment.coachingPrompt: Mochi relies on the specific properties of glutinous rice flour—what makes this starch different from all-purpose flour?
